prompt: A is B's brother. C is D's father. E is B's mother. A is C's son. How is E related to D?
explanation: A is C's son, so C is A's father. A is B's brother, so C is B's father too. E is B's mother. C and E are B's parents. D is C's child. So E is D's mother.

prompt: P is Q's mother. Q is R's sister. S is R's father. T is Q's daughter. How is T related to S?
explanation: S is R's father. R is Q's sibling. So S is Q's father too. T is Q's daughter. T is S's granddaughter.

prompt: X is Y's son. Z is X's sister. W is Z's mother. V is W's husband. How is Y related to V?
explanation: W is Z's mother. Z is X's sister. So W is X's mother. V is W's husband = X's father. X is Y's son, so Y is X's parent. If Y is X's father, Y = V.

prompt: A and B are brothers. C is A's daughter. D is B's son. How are C and D related?
explanation: A and B are brothers. C is A's daughter, D is B's son. C and D are cousins.

prompt: M is N's grandmother. O is N's father. P is O's brother. How is P related to M?
explanation: M is N's grandmother. O is N's father. M is O's mother. P is O's brother. So P is M's son.

prompt: J is K's wife. L is M's son. K is L's father. How is J related to M?
explanation: K is L's father. J is K's wife. So J is L's mother. M has son L. If M is L's other parent (mother), J and M are same. If M is L's grandmother, different relation.

prompt: A is B's father. C is B's son. D is C's mother. How is D related to A?
explanation: C is B's son. D is C's mother. So D is B's wife. A is B's father. D is A's daughter-in-law.

prompt: P's mother is Q's daughter. R is Q's husband. How is P related to R?
explanation: Q's daughter is P's mother. R is Q's husband = Q's daughter's father. P's mother's father = P's grandfather. R is P's grandfather. P is R's grandchild.

prompt: X is Y's sister. Y is Z's mother. W is X's husband. How is W related to Z?
explanation: X is Y's sister. Y is Z's mother. So X is Z's aunt. W is X's husband = Z's uncle.

M is N's son. O is N's daughter. P is M's son. Q is O's daughter. How are P and Q related?
explanation: M and O are siblings (both N's children). P is M's son, Q is O's daughter. P and Q are cousins.

prompt: G's father is H's brother. I is H's son. How is G related to I?
explanation: H is G's father's brother = G's uncle. I is H's son = G's cousin.

prompt: A is B's mother-in-law. C is B's husband. D is A's daughter. How is D related to B?
explanation: A is B's mother-in-law = C's mother. D is A's daughter = C's sister. D is B's sister-in-law.

prompt: P married Q. R is P's brother. S is Q's sister. T is R's wife. How is T related to S?
explanation: T married R (P's brother). S is Q's sister. P and Q married. T and S are in-laws but no direct blood relation.

prompt: X is Y's only brother's only sister. How is X related to Y?
explanation: Y's only brother's only sister is Y (if Y is female) or X is Y's sister if Y is male with only one brother.
